snippet.title: Amber Heard claims Johnny Depp took out penis & wrote her name in pee on walls
snippet.description: Johnny Depp's former estate manager Ben King was in court today giving evidence in day seven of the actor's libel trial against The Sun.  King says he worked for the actor in October 2014 in London, 2015 in Australia and 2016 in Vancouver, Canada.  David Sherborne, the barrister for Depp asked King about Amber Heard's claim Depp took out his penis and peed outside the front door' and then did it inside too.  She said: "He was trying to write my name peeing on the walls and carpet walking through the house."  King said he did not find any trace of urine inside the house.  Read More Related Articles  Read More Related Articles   He also said Depp did not drink when they first met.  King said he was told the actor was teetotal at his interview for the job.  He claimed Depp smoked cannabis around the house and said he never saw any violence between the couple.  King said from what he saw Heard was the `antagoniser' in their rows.  Read More Related Articles  Read More Related Articles   Depp's former manager also said he who cleaned up after the pair at a fight in their Australian house.  He said: "There was blood in the bar area. There was a trail of blood up the stairs and then bloodspots in one bedroom mainly but then a couple of other rooms."   Sherborne also asked about the flight King took back to LA with Heard.  King said Heard asked him about if he'd ever been so angry with someone he had "just lost it" at the beginning of the flight and then said they hardly spoke after that.  He also noticed marks on one of Heard's arms which were "diagonal downwards".
